node.title: Canberra family unknowingly buys asbestos-filled home for $1.8 million
node.alt: An empty swing, outside a grey-coloured home.
node.description: Dean Papas,Â a builder, knew well the ACT's dark history of "Mr Fluffy" housing, but must now watch his new home be demolished.
node.content:
["Dean Papas and his pregnant wife bought a house in May for $1.8 million, thinking they had found their growing family's \"forever home\".", "A builder by trade, Mr Papas\u00a0put his team to work immediately on a full renovation of the heritage property in the prestigious Canberra suburb of Reid.", "The couple had just moved in with\u00a0their two-year-old son when the dangerous discovery was made.\u00a0", "An electrician installing a bathroom fan had ventured deep into the ceiling cavity and peeled away ageing, yellow batts to find suspicious-looking fibres \u2014 dormant but potentially lethal.", "\"I didn't think it was going to eventuate into anything until they sent me a photo of what they had,\" Mr Papas said.", "Three decades after the original program to identify and clean up Canberra's so-called \"Mr Fluffy\"\u00a0homes \u2014 houses insulated with potentially deadly, loose-fill asbestos \u2014 another missed\u00a0property had been found.", "
'I've definitely been exposed'
", "", "
Dean Papas fears he exposed his family and staff to the potentially lethal material.(ABC News: Nick Haggarty)
", "The couple was thrilled to win the auction for the house; no easy feat in Canberra's\u00a0sky-high property market.", "\"This was our forever-after home, we were pinching ourselves for weeks after buying it,\" Mr Papas said.", "There was soon a frenzy of building activity in and around the house, which he described as \"pretty rough\" with \"cracks everywhere\".", "\"We had probably 30, 40 people here at any time just going crazy, it was pretty full-on,\" he said.", "\"We wanted to just get in here and get settled as soon as possible.\"", "The team laboured away on the 1927-built home over seven weeks, at times remarking how great it was not to need to worry about asbestos given the residence's age \u2014 an irony not lost on Mr Papas now.", "\"I know I've definitely been exposed to it,\" he said.", "He and the team knew well the dark history of Mr Fluffy: the common name for Dirk Jansen's business, which\u00a0pumped loose asbestos fibres into homes between 1968 and 1979 and kept no records of which or how many.", "But Mr Papas's workers had no need to enter the ceiling cavity, where the fibres were spotted, until after the renovation was complete.", "\"I know my trades have been exposed and I think that's the hardest part,\" he\u00a0said.", "\"It's one thing losing a property;\u00a0it's another thing wondering whether or not anyone \u2014 including myself or my family \u2014 in 20 or\u00a030 years' time is going to have repercussions from what's just happened.\"", "Exposure to asbestos is the cause of mesothelioma, an incurable form of cancer suffered by some former Mr Fluffy residents.", "The burden couldn't have fallen on Mr Papas at a worse time.", "He received the phone call from the testing laboratory the day that Canberra was plunged into a snap COVID-19 lockdown, which lasted nine weeks.\u00a0", "The family was permitted to stay in the house in the short term while they struggled to find an available rental property.", "\"We didn't know what to do \u2026 We were really kind of lost and scared and sad.\"", "
Reid house is sixth missed Mr Fluffy home found in Canberra\u00a0
", "", "
The Reid property will become the 993rd Mr Fluffy house demolished in Canberra.(ABC News: Nick Haggarty)
", "ACT Asbestos Response Taskforce staff believe the Reid property was inspected along with the city's 65,000 homes as part of the original removal program between 1989 and 1993.", "But the remediation of about 1,000 homes was botched: some homes were cleaned poorly and others were missed altogether.", "The ACT government has now identified six affected properties since it embarked on its $1 billion scheme in 2014\u00a0to buy back and demolish all homes tainted by Mr Fluffy asbestos.", "The day Mr Papas and his wife bought the Reid property, he inspected the roof cavity himself, more out of curiosity than genuine concern.", "\"I'd never seen a ceiling cavity from the 1920s so that was kind of interesting for me as a builder,\" he said.", "He picked up a few batts through the manhole, had a look around but \"nothing really seemed untoward\" and he said he never\u00a0suspected Mr Fluffy.", "", "
Some of the loose fibres found in Mr Papas's new Reid home.(Supplied)
", "A regular building inspection\u00a0for a house\u00a0before it is sold in the ACT only includes general advice about the likely location of asbestos.", "A \"full asbestos assessment\" does pick up the presence of loose-fill asbestos.\u00a0The taskforce recommended in 2014 that these assessments\u00a0be mandatory for the sale of any home built before 1980.", "However, that recommendation was not adopted. In the wake of Mr Papas's case,\u00a0the\u00a0ACT's Sustainable Building Minister, Rebecca Vassarotti, reviewed the matter again but rejected the idea.", "\"The ACT government considered that the current provisions, including mandatory asbestos awareness training for tradespeople, had been effective in identifying the relatively small number of homes that have been detected since the scheme commenced,\" Ms Vassarotti said in a statement.", "Mr Papas has implored authorities to think again and act to prevent another family from having a similarly stressful experience.", "\"It's pretty annoying.\u00a0I think it's a no-brainer, it's not going to cost the government any money to do this, it's a cost that will go on to sellers or buyers,\" he said.", "
Responsibility for full asbestos check remains with\u00a0owners
", "", "
Asbestos taskforce head Lea Durie says there may be more undiscovered Mr Fluffy houses.(ABC News: David Scasci)
", "Taskforce head\u00a0Lea Durie\u00a0acknowledged there might be more undiscovered Mr Fluffy properties in Canberra, and encouraged potential buyers and owners to get properties checked.\u00a0", "\"What we would do is encourage anybody who thinks that they may have loose-fill asbestos in their property or are considering buying a property that they are concerned about that they engage an asbestos assessor to investigate,\" she said.\u00a0", "Mr Papas also backed another of the taskforce's 2014 recommendations: that an asbestos assessment be required for owners contemplating renovating or maintaining homes built before 1980.", "His Reid\u00a0property will be demolished in coming months after the family signed a contract to allow the ACT government to clear the house, before they regain the cleared block and rebuild:\u00a0a rare opportunity in Reid's heritage precinct.", "\"We're going to maintain that culture and that history in the new build that we do,\" Mr Papas said."]
